result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas C L Koutsios was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Concurrent with: Count 5

miscConds.notes:
Bond amount posted shall be applied.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. 

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and then taken as prescribed.  

Defendant shall not associate with known drug dealers or users and shall not be present where illegal drugs are used, stored, packaged, sold or consumed.  

Defendant shall have no contact with S. L. K. or her residence unless contact complies with 22CV24 and with written agent approval.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.  

Defendant shall comply with random drug and alcohol screens.  

Defendant shall notify agent within 48 hours of being prescribed medication or any changes in medication.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

Bond amount posted shall be applied.  lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. 

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
All conditions of probation in Count 5 are inclusive of Count 3 conditions.

Court makes statements and concerns and has empathy for defendant's loss and Court denies the Motion to Modify in all respects.  Court maintains the 2-16-2022 court date.  Not guilty plea entered by Court.
